issues.description: The problem statement consistently refers to the interface for rideable animals as 'Rideable' (UML, task descriptions, and 'Main.java' in template). However, the solution repository implements this interface under the name 'Mountable', leading to a direct contradiction in the required interface name. Students following the problem statement will create 'Rideable', while the solution expects 'Mountable'.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename 'Mountable.java' to 'Rideable.java' in the solution repository and update all references to 'Mountable' to 'Rideable' in 'Pig.java' and 'Seal.java' in the solution repository.

issues.description: The 'singFarmSongVerse' method in 'Farm.java' in the template repository has its 'Animal animal' parameter commented out, making it appear as if it takes no arguments. The problem statement's UML and the solution repository correctly show and implement this method with the 'Animal' parameter, which is crucial for its functionality.
issues.suggested_fix: Uncomment 'Animal animal' in the 'singFarmSongVerse' method signature in 'template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Farm.java' to 'private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal)'.

issues.description: The problem statement explicitly requires an 'abstract class Animal', which serves as the base class for all animals. However, the 'Animal.java' file is entirely missing from the 'template_repository'. This prevents students from implementing the core inheritance structure.
issues.suggested_fix: Create an empty 'Animal.java' file with 'public abstract class Animal {}' in 'template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Animal.java'.

issues.description: The problem statement implies that the 'Animal' class should have a constructor to initialize its 'name' attribute. Since the 'Animal.java' file is missing from the template, this constructor is also missing, preventing proper instantiation of animal subclasses.
issues.suggested_fix: After creating 'Animal.java', add 'public Animal(String name) { /* TODO: Initialize name */ }' to 'template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Animal.java'.

issues.description: The problem statement's UML and text specify that the 'Animal' class should have a private 'name' attribute of type 'String'. Since the 'Animal.java' file is missing from the template, this attribute is also missing.
issues.suggested_fix: After creating 'Animal.java', add 'private String name;' to 'template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Animal.java'.

issues.description: The problem statement's UML and text explicitly require the 'Animal' class to have an abstract method 'messageOnFeed()' returning 'String'. Since the 'Animal.java' file is missing from the template, this method is also missing.
issues.suggested_fix: After creating 'Animal.java', add 'public abstract String messageOnFeed();' to 'template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Animal.java'.

issues.description: The problem statement explicitly requires getter and setter methods for the 'name' attribute in the 'Animal' class. Since the 'Animal.java' file is missing from the template, these methods are also missing.
issues.suggested_fix: After creating 'Animal.java', add 'public String getName() { return null; /* TODO */ }' and 'public void setName(String newName) { /* TODO */ }' to 'template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Animal.java'.

issues.description: The problem statement explicitly requires the 'Rideable' interface. However, the 'Rideable.java' file is entirely missing from the 'template_repository'. issues.suggested_fix: Create an empty 'Rideable.java' file with 'public interface Rideable {}' in 'template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Rideable.java'.

issues.suggested_fix: Add 'private List<Animal> animals;' to 'template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Farm.java'.

issues.description: The problem statement and template consistently refer to the interface for rideable animals as 'Rideable', as shown in the UML diagram and task descriptions. However, the solution repository implements and uses an interface named 'Mountable' for the exact same conceptual entity. This direct naming conflict creates significant confusion for students attempting to map the requirements to the provided solution structure and will lead to compilation errors if they follow the problem statement's naming.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the 'Mountable' interface to 'Rideable' in the solution repository (Mountable.java) and update all classes that implement or refer to it (Pig.java, Seal.java, and Main.java comments) to use 'Rideable' for consistency with the problem statement and template.
